column2: TENNESSEE DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: Tennessee

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.

column2: 2. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.
column6: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column8: all vehicles must turn left immediately.

column2: 3. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column4: It helps increase your stopping distance.
column8: It improves the steering ability.

column2: 4. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: watch for workers crossing the road.
column8: None of the above.

column2: 5. This sign indicates:
column4: Phone service ahead
column8: Cell phone shop ahead

column2: 6. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.
column8: Yes, always.

column2: 7. To maintain an adequate "space cushion" to the front, drivers need to:
column4: control their speed to suit the road and traffic conditions.
column6: keep a safe distance between their car and the vehicle in front.
column8: The other answers are both correct.

column2: 8. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.
column6: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
column8: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.

column2: 9. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
column4: soft shoulder
column8: hill

column2: 10. This sign means:
column4: road construction.
column8: narrow bridge ahead.

column2: 11. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column4: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.
column8: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 12. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column6: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column8: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: Persons with Disabilities Parking
column8: Merge

column2: 14. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column6: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column8: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.

column2: 15. This sign means:
column4: The center lane is shared for left turns.
column8: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.

column2: 16. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
column4: must obey
column8: take precedence over

column2: 17. When entering an interstate highway, drivers should:
column4: wait for an opening in traffic on the entrance ramp.
column6: adjust speed to meet a traffic gap, then merge at a safe speed.
column8: check for cars and slow down to 25 MPH before merging with the flow of traffic.

column2: 18. Blind spots are:
column4: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
column6: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column8: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.

column2: 19. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: You.
column8: Whoever enters the intersection first.

column2: 20. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column6: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column8: you are not allowed to park here.

column2: 21. Collisions can happen more often when:
column4: one lane of traffic is traveling faster than the others.
column6: one vehicle is traveling faster than the flow of traffic.
column8: all vehicles are traveling at the posted speed limit.

column2: 22. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column6: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 23. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column4: vehicles from the right.
column8: vehicles from both directions.

column2: 24. This is:
column4: a right curve sign.
column8: a side road sign.

column2: 25. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column8: Pull the steering wheel back.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column4: Keep left
column8: Lane ends

column2: 27. Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving ability is permitted:
column4: if it is prescribed by a physician.
column8: if you dont feel drowsy.

column2: 28. When you come to an intersection which has a flashing red light, you must:
column4: come to a full stop, then proceed when safe to do so.
column6: stop only if other vehicles are already in the intersection.
column8: slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary.

column2: 29. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.
column6: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column8: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.

column2: 30. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.
column8: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
